properties.Description: After the Coogee to Bondi Beach Walk, my friend and I went to Funky Pies for lunch. They serve all vegan food, and their speciality is the famous Australian hand pie.
Bondi Beach is absolutely beautiful. Walking up to it from the beach walk is surreal.
I met up with a friend in Coogee to do the Coogee to Bondi Beach Walk.
After lunch it started raining, so my friend and I ducked into Fonda for some after-lunch drinks at Fonda, a hip Mexican inspired restaurant with cool cocktails.
Golden Lotus is an amazing vegan restaurant in Newtown, serving Vietnamese and East Asian dishes.

I stayed at the Veriu Randwick while attending a conference at UNSW. I loved that it had a kitchenette and was close to everything I needed. The balcony was definitely a highlight, and my room was just high enough for a slight sea view. Unfortunately, it was too cold to really enjoy the outdoor space.
After getting settled (and taking a long nap) in my hotel, I needed some food, and Soul Burger fed my soul! I went a couple times while I was staying in the area.
I attended a conference at UNSW, and while the conference was great, I was really impressed by the university!

The conference I attended had an event at the Powerhouse Museum. I was preoccupied with the free-flowing sparkling wine and did not explore too much, but it seemed like the museum had a lot of exhibits dedicated to transportation. They even had a Mars Exhibit that reminded me of my days working at Space Camp.
The conference banquet was set on a boat cruise, which left from Darling Harbor. We cruised around the harbor and saw the Vivid Festival light up the opera house, harbor bridge, and the city.
After the conference, I went to Katoomba for some hiking in the Blue Mountains! I stayed at the Flying Fox Backpackers, an awesome eco-hostel.
The trail to Wentworth Falls went by the Weeping Rock, and it was very serene.
After walking down to Wentworth Falls, I went a bit further along the National Pass. It got a bit too technical for me as a solo-hiker, but the views were phenomenal.
Of course, the first thing I wanted to see when arriving in Katoomba was the Three Sisters.
The Three Sisters are crowded with tourists, and the hostel owner suggested I also take the Leura Forest/Falls trail. There were a lot of look outs and not a lot of tourists.

On my second day I went to Wentworth Falls. Hiking alone, I didn't want to go somewhere too remote, and the narrow stairs down to the falls made it so that I was never walking along the trail alone for too long.

One of my favorite parts about Katoomba and The Blue Mountains is that all the trails were accessible from public transit. From the train, I was able to walk along the Darwin Walk to get to Wentworth Falls. It was an easy walk and really enjoyable!
After my trip to Katoomba, I stayed a night at The Pod Sydney before heading back home.
On my last day in Sydney, I had an amazing cafe breakfast at Shift Eatery. I had the "Best Vegan Bacon and Egg Bagel in the World" and a matcha latte.

One of the many things I loved about Sydney was all of the free museums! I went to the Museum of Contemporary Art in the Rocks District. I didn't spend too much time there, but it's worthwhile to visit, if only for the view from cafe. I also enjoyed walking around the historic district after visiting the museum.

properties.Place: Art Gallery of New South Wales
properties.Description: On my last day in Sydney, I spent a rainy day at the Art Gallery of New South Wales. There is a wide range of art there from classical and contemporary to local indigenous artists' works.
